Golf outlet offers the sport’s essentials ...  of Regency Hilltop Shopping Center. (Eric Hodies/Freelance) There seems to be a change to the golf store at Regency Hilltop Shopping Center? A2Z Golf Outlet opened Feb. 15 in the space previously occupied by Addicted to Golf. Advertisement The Laskin Road storefront offers nearly 4,900-square-feet of clothes, accessories and club repair, according to owner Quirino Arzadon. A2Z sells footwear by Adidas, Asics, FootJoy and Puma, and an in-store hitting simulator is available. "Virginia Beach has so many great golf courses, and this is a great location for a golf store," Arzadon said. "Our community needs a family type place like this." Advertisement A2Z Golf Outlet is located in Suite 301 at 1940 Laskin Road, next to Running Etc. Eric Hodies ...

Mark Cuban on NBA Changing Basketball Supplier: 'I'm Sure We Learned Our Lesson' ...  than they ever have. There are things we certainly learned from 2006." On the whole, technological advancements are good for sports. Fans often get an improved viewing experience, and athletes can learn better ways to optimize their performance and health. Equipment is one area where maintaining the status quo can be the best route. The Adidas Jabulani ball adopted for the 2010 World Cup is perhaps the most famous example. Adidas and FIFA combined to deliver a ball that was perfected so much it basically didn't fly correctly. Wilson will want to leave its imprint on a new basketball, maybe with a new design element. But the Spalding ball has worked for decades, so a complete overhaul similar to the synthetic experiment could be counterproductive ...

Miami Hurricanes bringing some players back this week for important step ... , who owns All-Canes in Coral Gables, has received hundreds of requests and hopes to get the licensed masks in his shop in the coming weeks. College merchandise stores are among thousands of businesses that have suffered during the pandemic. Rothwell has sold a dozen to two dozen jerseys over the past three months, less than usual, and the shipment of 2020 jerseys has been slowed because Adidas factories were closed due to COVID-19. If only a limited number of fans - or no fans at all - are permitted at Canes football games, then that would result in much lower merchandise sales, Rothwell said. He hopes fans will still buy things to wear - or hold - when they get together at homes of friends or family to watch Canes games. Rothwell's store re-opened ...
